course_title: Topics in Postcolonial Literature: Postcolonial Fictions
class_notes:
(Reading novels, stories and essays from postcolonial Africa, Asia, Britain, and the Caribbean as well as its diasporas around the world, this course explores the cultural and socio-political legacies of colonialism. How do colonial formations influence postcolonial identities? In a rapidly globalizing world, what place do national identities have, if any? How do we define 'traditional' and 'modern' in a time of fluid identities? How are these ideas of tradition gendered and why? As you examine characters, motivations, and themes, don't forget to bring the lesson home, and ask yourself, how does history write you as a subject in this world?)
(Requirements: Canvas posts for every class meeting, presentation, formal expository paper.)
course_description: New literatures in English by writers from former British colonies.
